arm_group.description: Patients who undergo rehabilitation and anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction, other surgical interventions may be performed
Patients who undergo rehabilitation without anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction, other surgical interventions may be performed

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to evaluate knee function, sports participation and knee reinjuries
      over 2 years in a group of patients who choose either nonsurgical or surgical treatment for
      an anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury

clinical_study.brief_title: Nonsurgical or Surgical Treatment of ACL Injuries

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is a part study of an overall study with the title 'Dynamic stability of the
      ACL-injured knee'. The overall study prospectively follows a cohort of newly injured
      patients with total rupture of the anterior cruciate ligament in the knee.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Anterior cruciate ligament rupture within 3 months of injury

          -  Preinjury participation in level I or II sports at least twice a week

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Current or previous injury to the contralateral leg

          -  Another grade III ligament injury, fracture, full-thickness articular cartilage
             damage

study_pop.textblock: Athletically active anterior cruciate ligament injured patients

facility.name: NAR- Department of Orthopaedics, Oslo University Hospital & Nimi

clinical_study.official_title: Dynamic Stability of the ACL Deficient Knee

overall_official.affiliation: Norwegian Research Center for Active Rehabilitation

secondary_outcome.measure: Isokinetic knee extensor and flexor muscle strength
